de.uos.dgrlvq.distance
Class SimpleEuclideanDistance

java.lang.Object
  de.uos.dgrlvq.distance.SimpleEuclideanDistance
All Implemented Interfaces:
DistanceInterface
public class SimpleEuclideanDistance
extends java.lang.Object
implements DistanceInterface

This class implements simple Euclidean distance for the calculation of distance matrices environment.

Author:
Gulraj Singh Mrok, University Osnabrück, Germany

Method Detail

setLambdas

public void setLambdas(double[] lambdas)
Description copied from interface: DistanceInterface
Sets the global lambda relevance vector to distance matrices. The relevance vector lambda L1, L2… Ln is fixed with square(L1) + square(L2)+ … + square(Ln)=1 where n=dimension of training vector. The lambda relevance vector tells the relevance factor of certain dimention. in other words it tells how important certain dimention is.

Specified by:
setLambdas in interface DistanceInterface
Parameters:
lambdas - The lambda relevance vector

normalizeLambdas

public void normalizeLambdas()
Description copied from interface: DistanceInterface
Normalizes Lambda relevance vector. This means the relevance vector lambda L1, L2… Ln must stay as square(L1) + square(L2)+ … + square(Ln)=1 where n=dimension of training vector.

Specified by:
normalizeLambdas in interface DistanceInterface

calculateDistance

public double calculateDistance(double[] a,
                                double[] b)
Calcules distance between two vectors. for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) { diff = a[i]-b[i]; sum += Math.pow(diff,2); } return Math.sqrt(sum);

Specified by:
calculateDistance in interface DistanceInterface
Parameters:
a - first vector
b - second vector
Returns:
Euclidean distance

derivativeLamdba

public double derivativeLamdba(double[] inputs,
                               double[] weights,
                               int i)
Returns one of the simplest derivative form wrt lambda. return (inputs[i]-weights[i]);

Specified by:
derivativeLamdba in interface DistanceInterface
Parameters:
inputs - input vector
weights - weight vector
i - index
Returns:
returns just the differance between input and weight.

derivativeWeights

public double derivativeWeights(double[] x,
                                double[] w,
                                int comp_idx)
Returns one of the simplest derivative form wrt weights. return (x[comp_idx]-w[comp_idx]);

Specified by:
derivativeWeights in interface DistanceInterface
Parameters:
x - input vector
w - weight vector
comp_idx - index
Returns:
differance between two vectors.
